attributes.action: Spend £6m of foreign aid so 40 or Paralympics teams can attend Rio2016
attributes.background: There are around 40 countries that are unable to attend the Paralympics in Rio because of a funding shortfall. As well as being a good thing to do, it would show GB in a good light.  https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2016/aug/14/paralympic-committee-to-hold-budget-crisis-talks-with-brazil

attributes.action: abolish hate crime laws in the UK
attributes.background: A crime is a crime. the motivation for committing the offence should be inconsequential to the sentencing. Labelling an offence as racially, religiously or gender motivated only serves to create an 'us and them' mentality.
attributes.additional_details: In recent months police have been silencing anti  Islam and anti  refugee opinions by labelling them as hate crimes. recently Nottinghamshire police have taken the law into their own hands and have made misogyny a hate crime (but not misandry). This has turned certain groups into protected classes in society.

attributes.action: Encourage the EEA to pemit UK visa holders to travel freely in the Schengen area
attributes.background: As a resident in the UK with a valid UK visa, it seems unnecessary that a Schengen visa is required for tourism/business purposes in the Schengen area. Some form of long term visit visa with stringent background checks might be a good solution.
attributes.additional_details: I am an Indian citizen working as an Engineer in the UK. I enjoy travelling in my spare time and I also have the need to attend business meetings in the Schengen area. I have personally experienced the trouble of applying for short term visit visas (both Tourism and Business).  I encourage the the honourable UK govt. to urge the EU to look into a solution to this, by offering a longer term visa, with restrictions on the maximum number of days spent continuously in the EU. This solution could be offered to someone who has travelled to the EU at least twice, to prove that the country of interest is the UK.

attributes.action: To make sure every care home has CCTV  to protect the elderly
attributes.background: After my grandmother was treated appallingly by home care staff in her own home and in care homes.
attributes.additional_details:
The police have cameras attached to them and I think carers should have the same kind of thing to stop the abuse of elderly people.
My gran died from blood poisoning caused by bed sores after carers did not provide adequate care

attributes.action: Introduce a National Childcare Service
attributes.background: A National Childcare Service (NCS) offering free universal childcare to all children from one to fourteen. The NCS would be funded through general taxation. Free universal childcare scares many. It will have a high cost in a time of austerity however the return will more than justify the outlay.
attributes.additional_details: A stable high-quality early childhood education and care system should be regarded as part of the infrastructure for the country's long-term economic and social development. What it requires is that government takes the longer view rather than a horizon that stretches only to the next election.

attributes.action: GET WAITING TIMES OF DRIVING TESTS DOWN TO WITHIN 3 WEEKS
attributes.background: WAITING TIMES FOR DRIVING TESTS AROUND THE COUNTRY ARE GETTING LONGER AT THE MOMENT IT CAN BE AS LONG AS 3 MONTHS, THIS IS CAUSING SEVERE PROBLEMS TO PUPILS AND DRIVING INSTRUCTORS . ALSO TESTS ARE BEING CANCELLED  IN THE WAITING ROOM AND THE PUPILS ARE NOT GETTING THE REQUIRED NOTICE .
attributes.additional_details: IN MY AREA OF WORK THE EARLIEST DRIVING TEST APPOINTMENT IS 1ST NOV  THE DATE TODAY  IS 20TH JULY I WOULD CHALLENGE ANYONE IN THE COUNTRY TO FORECAST 3 MONTHS IN ADVANCE WEATHER A PUPIL WILL BE READY FOR THERE DRIVING TEST .THIS WAITING TIME IS NOT CAUSING JUST EXTRA PRESSURE ON A PUPIL TO PASS 1ST TIME BUT ALSO CAUSING THE DRIVING INSTRUCTOR EXTRA PRESSURE AND MAKING US LOOK LIKE COMPLETE IDIOTS. THE DVSA GET PAID FOR A SERVICE THEY ARE NOT PROVIDING CAUSING UNDUE STRESS AND PROBLEMS

attributes.action: Make Counselling and Psychotherapy a professional qualification.
attributes.background:
Anyone is able to set up in private practice and call themselves a Counsellor or Psychotherapist.
I would like a minimum qualification that is recognised by a regulatory body, such as the BACP, to benchmark a qualification to prevent poorly trained or unqualified individuals from practising.

attributes.action: I want the mandatory tv licence in September to be abolished.
attributes.background: Come September 1 2016 you will be required by law to purchase a television licence, regardless of how you watch - this includes YouTube and BBC iPlayer etc.
attributes.additional_details:
From the TV licence website - 

No matter what device you use, you must be covered by a TV Licence if you watch or record live TV. This includes:
TV sets
Laptops and desktop computers
Tablets, mobile phones, satnavs and other portable devices
Digital boxes (PVRs), satellite and cable, e.g. Freeview, Freesat, Sky, Virgin Media, BT Vision, YouView, Apple TV, Chromecast, Roku and Amazon Fire TV
Games consoles
DVD, Blu-ray and VHS recorders

http://www.tvlicensing.co.uk/check-if-you-need-one

attributes.action: Call for Turkey's removal from NATO
attributes.background:
The North Atlantic Council, should formally oust Turkey from NATO for good before its belligerence and continual aggression drags the international community into World War III.
Under Erdogan, our NATO ally has arrested more journalists than China, jailed thousands for the crime of free speech.
attributes.additional_details: Erdogan publicly flaunted his support for Hamas & ISIS while accusing Israel of crimes against humanity, violated an arms ban to Gaza, bought an air defense system from the Chinese in defiance of NATO, and denied America the use of its own air base to conduct strikes during the Iraqi War & ISIS in Syria. Turkey has been tacitly fueling the ISIS war machine. There is evidence to show that Turkey has allowed jihadists from around the world to swarm into Syria by crossing through Turkey’s territory

attributes.action: Change the conveyancing process in England to make buying & selling more secure.
attributes.background: I have been working in the property industry since 2000 and now own my own Estate Agency firm. Over the last 16 years I have seen thousands of people who have been messed around by buyers and sellers alike. This has resulted in heartache, stress and the loss of substantial amounts of money.
attributes.additional_details: On average over 30% of sales fall through each year in England, the knock on effect of this can ruin people’s lives. Almost every country around the world other than England dictates that both, buyers and sellers have to pay a NON refundable deposit to secure the property. If either party withdraw the deposit is forfeited. In England a buyer or seller can pull out up to the day of exchange. One thoughtless person can ruin people’s lives with no consequence. Let's put a stop to it.

attributes.action: A Royal Yacht with duel role to promote trade around the world must be built.
attributes.background: Nowhere on Britannia's side did you see her name, yet she was recognised around the world. She should be  built for the dual role of signing trade agreements and promoting British trade delegations and act as a base for state visits by Her Majesty.
attributes.additional_details: https://youtu.be/VtghpGfgPRM

attributes.action: Not just blindly leave the EU but instead establish a Royal Commission
attributes.background: The referendum was enacted so that a simple majority would be sufficient to establish a decision. For deciding the future of a union refined over 43 years, this would not make sense unless the result was advisory. Since the majority was 52% over 48%, the result should not be followed blindly.
attributes.additional_details:
In addition, there is evidence to suggest that many people used their vote not for its intended purpose but to register a protest with the government.

Also, in law the referendum result is not legally binding upon the government; it is merely advisory.

As such, the result should not be followed blindly, with no intervening steps between the result and the government acting to leave the EU.

The Government should establish a Royal Commission, or other suitable body, to investigate.

attributes.action: Changes to Protect 'Asthma' Sufferers from Smoke from Garden Fires, Clean Air.
attributes.background: Asthma sufferers need protecting from Smoke from Garden Fires in Law, in this day and age with Air pollution it can be a Killer for not only these but anyone who has a Lung and Breathing issue, Clean Air act does Not Protect these people at this time, they have a right to live and breath.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government talks on so called Clean Air but have Failed to look into these people and Protect them in Law, very wrong and selfish on their part as you have to have the issue to know, also Hay Fever another Lung issue from the same.

There are Recycling outlets to stop this and Must be used by All and Not the Few, Fires also cause issues with Wildlife and Nesting Birds which are Declining at a large rate.

Common sense must Prevail.

attributes.action: Abolish extra charges for holidays during school holidays for single travellers
attributes.background: Stop or limit the travel compainies charging a premiuim on holidays for people travelling without children during term breaks.
attributes.additional_details: As a single person who travels alone or with friends its unfair that we have to pay extra for a holiday if its during a school break. This also limits the amount of time we can take off work lossing around 8 weeks per year. A holiday for example to spain costs around £150-£250 more at such times. If like myself due to your work (healthcare) you cant take time off during half of November, all of December and half of January because of school break costs it limits exactly what you can have.

attributes.action: Guarantee that EU nationals legally settled here before the Referendum can stay.
attributes.background: We should honour our responsibility to treat fairly our friends and colleagues from other EU countries, who were legally settled in the UK before the June 23rd Referendum.

attributes.action: Bring back retrospective death penalty for murderers and paedophiles
attributes.background: I am a British citizen. And am fed up with the way we have to pay for scumbags to "enjoy their captivity"

attributes.action: Article 50 Lisbon treaty can only be invoked by 2/3 's majority of MP's
attributes.background:
The recent referendum showed different needs across the UK. 
As a parliamentary democracy we trust in elected MP's to make decisions on our behalf. 
Only a plan that a significant majority of MP's can support will re-unite the UK
attributes.additional_details:
There is currently no plan. It is the job of parliament  to ensure 
that before article 50 is invoked there is robust, coherent and competent plan in place that is in the interests of the UK as a whole and will deliver clear advantages and benefits to the UK over the current status quo as a member of the European Union.

attributes.action: Call on the Saudi Arabian leaders to decriminalise homosexuality
attributes.background: In Saudi Arabia, same-sex sexual activity is punishable by floggings, life imprisonment, chemical castration, whipping torture and even the death penalty. People convicted twice are executed. Please call on the Saudi Arabian government to end the suffering of homosexuals in Saudi Arabia.

attributes.action: Give voters more powers to unseat an MP who is not representing their interests
attributes.background: In the EU referendum, many constituents felt let down by their local MP, after showing support for the opposing view. In some instances it was abundantly clear the MP was completely at odds with their constituency, e.g. Kate Hoey. In such cases, we should be able to request a vote to unseat the MP.
attributes.additional_details: The Borough of Lambeth voted overwhelmingly in favour of remaining in the EU, with 79%, the highest in the England. The MP for Vauxhall Kate Hoey, campaigned for the UK to leave, which demonstrates that she no longer represents the interests of the majority of her constituents. This poses the question of whether she should remain in her seat or give her constituents the power to vote for a new MP.

attributes.action: Highlight the serious issue of mental health as a top Government priority.
attributes.background:
We believe that the Government should prioritise the issue of mental health as a priority.
The issue of mental health affects many families including both adults and children.
We feel that the time has come for Government to be more proactive in addressing this very serious area.

attributes.action: Both parents should have to sign off on the important decisions in a childs life
attributes.background: 8 and half week ago my sons dad decided he was keeping our son and not bringing him home.  I haven't seen or spoke to our son since. His dad was able to change his school and gp without my permission. I want the law to change so that both parents have to agree to important changes in a child's life
attributes.additional_details: Im having to fight tooth and nail just to speak to my son.  My heart is in pieces and i want to make sure no one else has to go through what im currently experiencing. Schools, doctors, passports etc should all have to require both parents signatures,  not just one parent.

attributes.action: Citizens must pass GCSE level maths and English to vote
attributes.background: Citizens under the age of 18 are unable to vote due to not being mature enough to understand implications of elections and referendums. However, maturity should not be determined by age.
attributes.additional_details:
Passing basic mathematical and English competency tests will ensure voters are able to better make informed choices, and understand the implications and consequences of their voting choice. 

Very often voters are misinformed, and unable to distinguish fact from fiction due to their lack of education. It should therefore go without saying that not being able to understand basic maths and English should also correlate with poor understanding of elections and referendums.

attributes.action: Formal identification required to sign petitions for Parliament to consider.
attributes.background: The Petitions sign on procedure to be changed to that like 'passenger information checks' on aircraft, in so far as formal identification be required for the petition to be accepted. UK Passport, or similar identification that proves the signatory is eligible, and to prevent fraud.
attributes.additional_details:
We have seen petitions are being fraudulently signed by people from all over the world on UK petitions, in particular in reference to the request for another referendum.

Anyone signing a petition MUST be legally eligible to do so, and the current system is being abused extensively and illegally. Having a formal system in place would not only prevent fraud, but where fraud does occur would offer the opportunity to take legal action against those concerned and maintain democracy.

attributes.action: add units to all special needs schools for children with advanced complex needs
attributes.background: My son Ashton 9 has severe autism severe learning difficulties PDA non verbal at times challenging behaviour.Has been told his special needs school can't cater to his needs the setting isn't right after 6 years that he needs a specialist unit and has to leave BUT there are no units in my region
attributes.additional_details: After been told Ashton has to leave his special needs school after 6 years of been there that the setting is not right And he needs a specialist unit at which I'm appalled can happen to a child after 6 years of routine and relationship building with staff how can this happen ..there's no units the nearest is 2 hours away with a ridicolous waiting list or I can send him to boarding unit miles away mon -fri which is not a option we'd be heartbroken as would he my only option is to home school now

attributes.action: At least 40% of those eligible to vote in a referendum must support change.
attributes.background: The Trade Union Act 2016 requires that at least 40% of those eligible to vote must back action for strikes in core public services. This is to limit disruption caused by an unrepresentative result. The same logic and rules should apply to a referendum, especially on important constitutional areas.

attributes.action: The UK should join EFTA and should stay out of the EEA and Schengen.
attributes.background: So we can maintain free trade with European countries whilst maintaining our borders outside of the EU

attributes.action: Stop government invoking Article 50 until there is a deal in UK's interests.
attributes.background: Most MPs, who are well aware of their constituents interests, support remaining in the EU.  They are the appropriate people to judge if deal is in the U.K.'s interests.  MPs should have the power to to ensure their constituents interests are safeguarded before there is an exit from the EU.

attributes.action: Create an independent state in Exeter, Devon and apply to join the EU.
attributes.background: Exeter people voted over 55% to remain in the EU.  Exeter is a thriving aspirational city with a very bright future has an expanding population.  Exeter has a bright future within EU, a distinctive culture and a world renowned food and produce heritage as well as a magnet for international business.

attributes.action: Give EU nationals living in the UK for 4 years or more automatic citizenship now
attributes.background:
We are asking parliament give citizenship to EU migrants living in the UK for more than 4 years to:

- prevent the loss of skilled workers
- honour year long contributions into the system 
- give re-assurance to over 3m EU migrants 
- make sure in future all views are represented and respected
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is not meant to be exclusive. Non-EU migrants have a clear set of defined rules however hence our friends are covered already and know where the road gores - WE DO NOT and need answers now from a country that has left us hanging. We represent almost 5% of the UK pubic - yet have no voice. 
4 years are based on the decisions made in the re-negotiations between the UK and the EU commission in Feb 2016. This petition follows the same rational (4 years entitle to benefits for example)

attributes.action: Match the money and resources currently invested in Cornwall by the EU.
attributes.background:
As part of the EU Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly benefited from The Cornwall and Isles of Scilly Growth Programme. This is currently worth €603,706,864 of EU funding.

The government must match the value of this funding after leaving the EU and ensure the continuation of its current projects.
attributes.additional_details:
Please refer to:
http://www.erdfconvergence.org.uk/growth-programme

attributes.action: Let us know the economic plan for departing the European Union. Immediately.
attributes.background: An economic plan for leaving the European Union was vague during the leave campaign. In the 24 hours post-brexit we have seen the decline of the GBP, businesses announcing they're leaving and the USA saying the UK goes to the back of the queue for a trade deal. We need to know what the plan is, now.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/06/23/eu-referendum-what-the-world-is-saying---britains-historic-decis/ 

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36611512

attributes.action: Increase public spending by £350 million per week as the Leave campaign promised
attributes.background: Government to increase direct spending on public services by £350,000,000 per week in real terms by the end of 2018, without increasing taxes, as the Brexit Leave campaign promised.

attributes.action: Make a ban on using plastic packaging for fruit and veg.
attributes.background: Bring back paper bags and cardboard containers for fruit and vegetables. The amount of plastic waste generated annually in the UK is estimated to be nearly 3 million tonnes. An estimated 56% of all plastics waste is used packaging, three-quarters of which is from households. Free the cucumber!

attributes.action: A motion of no confidence be brought against this government.
attributes.background: A motion of no confidence be brought against this government for misleading and lying to the general public over Britex.
attributes.additional_details: Half of the government say that the other half is not telling the truth, so it must be true that at least one half is not telling the truth according to our own elected representatives

attributes.action: Don't scrap A level/GCSE Electronics/Systems and control. Help future engineers.
attributes.background: Scrapping these subjects will cause a fall in the amount of students leaving school with any design or electronics experience or knowledge. We should be encouraging students to become enginneers to continue advancements in technology for the future, instead this opportunity is being taken from them.
attributes.additional_details: Gonernment changes to A levels and GCSEs are moving more towards pure academia and although physics and maths are critical in technology and electronics, to be successful in the industry you must still know how to design, how a circuit works, about microchips etc. The things you are not taught in physics. Without these subjects, less people will be inspired to make their own projects and those who are inspired will be ill equipped to do so and will struggle at degree level with no experience.

attributes.action: Change the law on Minimum Requirements for Riding a Motorcycle
attributes.background: I do not need to write a massive amount of issues here, but however when you see young teens on motorcycles riding in shorts and t-shirts, you think something should be done! at the moment the Law ONLY requires you to wear a helmet, I think basic  jeans and jackets should be Law as well as a helmet.

attributes.action: The government to put political pressure on the US to impose gun restrictions.
attributes.background: It is embarrassing for our nation to be in a close relationship with a country that refuses to put the safety of its citizens first. Today yet another mass shooting has taken place and over 50 members of the LGBT community have died. We can not support any government that allows this to happen.

attributes.action: Mindfulness Meditation on the Curriculum
attributes.background: Add mindfulness meditation to the school curriculum to tackle the issues of stress, anxiety and poor concentration amongst young people.
attributes.additional_details: The Science Behind Mindfulness Meditation: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wP9731bDJlE

attributes.action: Ban the Union Jack on labels and advertising on products not made in the UK
attributes.background: Customers should be able to make their choice of goods based on where products are substantially made. Whether it's sausages, clothes or electrical goods we need to have this information. Advertisers should not be able to put a Union Jack on goods that are not substantially British!

attributes.action: Ban "haul route" traffic lights on the A21 between Tunbridge Wells and Tonbridge
attributes.background: Anyone who uses the A21 between Tonbridge and Tunbridge Wells knows that the road works to widen it are essential. However the "haul route" traffic light system is not, especially in rush hour times. The undersigned feel that the use of these temporary traffic lights should be banned in rush hour.
attributes.additional_details: With these traffic lights in place a journey that normally takes 20 minutes can sometimes take over an hour. The constant cuing that results from these lights causes inconvenience, lateness, and in some cases car crashes. We feel that traffic conditions caused by these lights are dangerous and that having to get up almost an hour earlier for work/school (especially in the fast exam season), or getting home unessasarily late is unreasonable.

attributes.action: Ban diesel fuel! We deserve cleaner air.
attributes.background: Diesel fuel is slowly killing us. Let's get rid of it and live healthier, longer lives.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.theguardian.com/business/2016/apr/21/all-top-selling-cars-break-emissions-limits-in-real-world-tests

attributes.action: Standardise Breastfeeding Advice & Support
attributes.background: Breastfeeding can be hard to establish without correct support or advice. Many mothers turn to formula and regret not being able to breastfeed. I found it incredibly confusing, being given conflicting advice from one midwife to the next, and found it daughting when I went home from hospital.
attributes.additional_details: You may have heard the saying: Breast is Best, but in the UK we have a considerably low number of breastfeeding mothers compared to other European countries. A lot of mothers turn to formula through lack of support or advice. So this petition is aimed at standardising the support and advice given. We need a better structure in place to help breastfeeding mothers to establish, maintain and continue breastfeeding for as long as they wish to nurse their baby/toddler.

attributes.action: Make June 15th (signing of the Magna Carta) a bank holiday
attributes.background: Magna Carta is the foundation of our country. It is the beginning of our parliament, the oldest parliament in the world, and the origins of how we view society. So far the only memorial to it was made by the Americans who understand its importance and we should notice the Magna Carta's importance.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magna_Carta
Wiki page for the Magna Carta

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4qj2vpp9Wf4
UK parliament YouTube Page with a video on the document itself

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KhVnHQVbtB8
Daniel Hannan MEP's speech on the 800th anniversary of Magna Carta - speaking at Runnymede

attributes.action: MPs and council leaders should cease second occupations until they leave office.
attributes.background: To prevent conflict of interest in the political arena, any person representing the PEOPLE should cease any activities that produce a second income.
attributes.additional_details: When persons are employed by the public purse they should put 100% of their effort into their job. It is known that some tenders for works within the public sector have directly and indirectly benefited State employed individuals. This is morally wrong and adds to the current lack of trust the Public have in our Government and Councils.

attributes.action: Plug The Loophole and Stop Cash in Hand paying No Tax, Unfair for Others Who Do
attributes.background:
The Inland Revenue must lose a great deal with Many people dealing in Cash in Hand with No Tax being Paid, Everyone Must give Invoices with Full details on them and Reciept given in every Transaction.

At this time there are far to many who Flout the System while Paye can Not, not a Level System.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people working on a self employed basis Rip the system off, make a lot of money as a Great deal does not go through the so Called books and is a Fraud but they get away with it due to the System, many Millions are Lost, there are many such areas one being Fast Food along the roads where only some goes through the books,

Others are Scrap and Rubbish around the Roads, house Clearance to name a few.

Trust this will be looked into with these issues in the Limelight.

attributes.action: Temporary Re-Nationalization of the Tata Steel - Port Talbot Plant.
attributes.background: The Steelworks are vital to the community of Port Talbot and Swansea Bay Area and if nothing is done then the wider community will suffer, So Temporary Re-Nationalization is needed to protect the jobs at the Plant. Over 3,500 Jobs depend on the Plant plus many more in the Supply Chain.

attributes.action: A higher minimum wage for people aged 18-20.
attributes.background: The minimum wage for people aged over 21 will be increasing in april. People who are younger than 21 often have the same needs as people who are over 21. Increasing the minimum wage for people under this age will encourage them to develop enriched futures.
attributes.additional_details:
People often can't afford to move out of their homes until they're over 21. If people earn more at a younger age they can save to develop their lives. This creates brighter futures for people who are unable to live with their parents well into their 20s-30s.

https://www.gov.uk/national-minimum-wage-rates

attributes.action: Make domestic violence a crime in its own right with clear sentencing guidelines
attributes.background: The impact of domestic violence on victims and children and the financial and emotional cost to society is huge. Violence is rarely an isolated event but part of a campaign. Again and again, perpetrators walk free from court  or receive nominal sentences: proportionate justice for victims is rare.
attributes.additional_details: Watch BBC's Behind Closed Doors and consider how often the sentence actually fits the crime and achieves justice for victims of DV. See www.cps.gov.uk/legal/s_to_u/sentencing_manual for common assault, actual bodily harm and grievous bodily harm. Unless the assault breaks the skin or bones, highest charge is ABH, max sentence is 5 years, likely 3 or less, out in half the time, minus remand time: likely released from court or very shortly after. Impact on victims and children is lifelong.

attributes.action: Make anyone who claims benefits do a few hours of community service a day
attributes.background: Anyone who claims benefits because they don't work, should be made to do a few hours of community service each day. I feel this would help as they are earning the money and giving back to the community, there is no reason for people to be getting money without working for it.
attributes.additional_details: This can also give people who are unable to find work added experience towards their CV, possibly making it easier for them to find a job in the future.

attributes.action: Save Violet Melchett Health Centre in Chelsea from Closure
attributes.background: Not only is it for family planning, the fantastic team also specialises in women's health and have helped me personally on numerous occasions with same day appointments, when I wasn't able to get an appointment with my GP. It would be a great loss to the Chelsea community if this centre closes.
attributes.additional_details:
https://community.avaaz.org/petitions/save-the-violet-melchett-health-centre-in-chelsea-1 

Chelsea may soon be losing its last remaining family planning clinic in plans being drawn up by the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea (RBKC) and the NHS, residents and staff have reported. This is despite sexual health diagnoses running at a three year high.

If plans to relocate the Violet Melchett family planning clinic are executed, Chelsea will be left without a dedicated primary family planning clinic.
